UPCOMING EVENTS Come out and join us for public events, dine in our three public restaurants.  Make new friends, learn a new sport, and have fun with a membership at our exclusive racquet and fitness club, nestled on the beautiful shores of Indian Harbour Beach. Here, you can perfect your game on our nine clay tennis courts, two hard courts, conquer our eight pickleball courts, get your sweat on in our fitness studio, and indulge in well-deserved pampering with personal training, massage, acupuncture, lessons, and clinics. Stock up on all your equipment needs in our pro shop, including demo rackets and paddles. Enjoy social events, camaraderie, and relaxation at our breezeway bar while enjoying culinary delights from The Palm at Kiwi restaurant and bar. Full Membership Our Full membership includes unlimited access to tennis, pickleball & fitness.  Complimentary clinics are included, in addition to discounted member pricing on private instruction, massage, personal training, and acupuncture.  Enjoy social events and everything the club has to offer. Full/Tennis+ Information Pickleball Membership Enjoy playing pickleball on our eight illuminated courts, and access to all fitness areas. Open Pickleball or private reservations are available, Complimentary clinics are included, in addition to discounted member pricing on private instruction, massage, personal training and acupuncture. Join us for all social activities and events. Pickleball Information Social Membership Work out in our strength training room and cardio studio, featuring new state-of-the art fitness equipment.  Hire a personal trainer to help you reach your fitness goals.  Enjoy onsite massage and acupuncture services at discounted member pricing.  Join us for all social activities and events. Social Information Kiwi Racquet and Fitness Club Club Automation Link 30 Tradewinds Drive, Indian Harbour Beach, FL 32937 321.773.2116 The Palm: 321-404-7256 Club Hours Monday        8 AM – 9 PM Tuesday         8 AM – 9 PM Wednesday   8 AM – 9 PM Thursday        8 AM – 9 PM Friday            8 AM – 9 PM Saturday        8 AM – 6 PM Sunday           8 AM – 6 PM Stay in the loop Sign up for our newsletter for upcoming news, events, and promotions. First Name Last Name Email Address Sign Up Thank you!  We look forward to seeing around the club!

All membership fees are subject to Florida sales tax. Annual Plans Single Full Club $2500 per year OR A monthly dues payment option is available. Call 321.773.2116 for details. Initiation Fee is $3000 Restaurant Minimums: $200/Qtr Family Full Club $3500 per year or OR A monthly dues payment option is available. Call 321.773.2116 for details. Initiation Fee is $5000 Restaurant Minimums: $300/Qtr Young Professional Full Club Ages 18 to 30 $1500 per year OR A monthly dues payment option is available. Call 321.773.2116 for details. Initiation Fee is $1800 Restaurant Minimums: $200/Qtr Junior Full Club Ages 18 and under $500 per year OR  A monthly dues payment option is available.  Call 321.773.2116 for details. Initiation Fee is $500 Restaurant Minimums: N/A Out of County Full Club - Single $1250 per year OR A monthly dues payment option is available. Call 321.773.2116 for details. Initiation Fee is $3000 Restaurant Minimums: $400 per year Proof of ‘out of county’ Brevard residency is required to qualify for Out of County Memberships. Out of County Full Club - Family $1750 per year OR A monthly dues payment option is available. Call 321.773.2116 for details. Initiation Fee is $5000 Restaurant Dues: $600 per year Proof of ‘out of county’ Brevard residency is required to qualify for Out of County Memberships. Flexible Plans Summer Single $625 for 90 days Initiation Fee is $600 Restaurant Minimums: $200 per 90 days. Summer Family $875 for 90 days Initiation Fee is $1000 Restaurant Minimums: $300 per 90 days Summer Young Professional Ages 18 to 30 $375 for 90 days Initiation Fee is $360 Restaurant Minimums: $200 for 90 days Summer Junior Ages 18 and under. $125 for 90 days Initiation Fee is $100 Restaurant Minimums: N/A 90 Day - Single $875 for 90 days Initiation Fee is $900 Restaurant Dues: $200 per 90 days 90 Day Family $1225 for 90 days. Initiation Fee is $1500 Restaurant Dues: $300 per 90 days 90 Day Young Professional Ages 18 to 30 $525 per 90 days Initiation Fee is $540 Restaurant Dues: $200 per 90 days 30 Day Trial Membership Purchase once per lifetime $500 Includes 4 complimentary 30 minute tennis lessons AND 4 complimentary 30 minute pickleball lesson. Full Membership Includes Pro Shop Discount As a member, you save 10% on all in-stock items in our pro shop. This excludes rackets, paddles, and items under $20. Discounted Lesson Rates You can access professional tennis, pickleball, and personal training sessions at discounted rates as a member.  Elevate your skills and fitness levels with our professional team. Racquet Clinics As a member, you can attend our free clinics for pickleball and tennis to enhance your skills and level up your game. Illuminated Courts Our facility boasts and 11 tennis courts and 8 top of the line pickleball courts all equipped with high-quality lighting for uninterrupted play day or night. Fitness Classes You’re welcome to join any member organized workouts or strength training sessions.  Schedule a private training session to increase your fitness level. House Account Privileges Add the cost of your extras to your monthly house account for easy and convenient payment for you and your family. T: +64 9 528-5428 E: For general enquiries & course information: bronwyn@tennis.kiwi FAQS How do I become an official? 1. In this section of the website you will be able to find information on all the different roles within officiating. Click on "Become An Official" page to start with. 2. From there, familiarize yourself with the different Officiating Roles , and the different pathways to achieve those positions. 3. Anyone interested in officiating can complete an Expression Of Interest Form so we can reach out to you when the next relevant course to you is. Please note that by registering for an expression doesn't automatically register you, people don't have to feel obligated to sit a course straight away, it allows Tennis NZ to see if new people are interested as some courses are held on a demand basis. 4. Any questions on starting in officiating please email bronwyn@tennis.kiwi At what level do you start needing officials? Generally at levels higher than standard Interclub competitions you can expect to start seeing officials. Any sanctioned event from Tier 3 and higher are required to have a certain number of officials depending on the level of tournament. For Regional events this is typically Referee and Court Supervisors. For National events, Referee and Court Supervisors are required and Chair Umpires and Line Umpires for the final round or two. At all international level tournaments from ITF Junior events through to ATP & WTA tournaments such as ASB Classic have an international minimum standard of officials per event. The higher the event the more officials are required. For a full rundown on the tournaments coming up in New Zealand, check out the Events Calendar . Do you have to be an extravert to be an official? All different personalities can be good officials. Some people are more suited to grass-root tennis and educating the new players coming through, which is an area that is very important. All officials don't have to work their way up a pathway, each area of the pathway is crucial to the success of tennis tournaments. What's the difference between a volunteer and an official? A volunteer is someone who does not need any particular prerequisite qualifications to help out at a tournament for no financial remuneration. Typically these are roles such as ushers, drivers, and general helpers. An Official at events receive a remuneration and requires qualifications. These are specific roles like Referee, Court Supervisors, Chair Umpires, Court Supervisors etc. Click here for a full list of different Officiating Roles. How difficult are the courses to become an official? We encourage anyone who is thinking about becoming and official to fill out an Expression of Interest Form . We are looking for enthusiastic people who fit the following criteria: Aged 14+ Have a passion for tennis Have a good general knowledge of tennis Share the values of Tennis New Zealand to be united, respectful, and strive for excellence Generally you will learn all you need to know at the courses, and they have a high pass rate. I have some overseas officiating experience. Can I use that to get certified in New Zealand? Each person and situation in this regard is unique, so please get in touch with us by sending an email to bronwyn@tennis.kiwi to discuss this further. How likely is it that I will get to work the event of my choosing once I get the right certification? It depends on many factors, like how many positions are available, how many other officials have registered etc. For Regional events, local officials (in most cases) are given first priority to ensure the tournament can afford officials. For National events, all officials applications are reviewed to provide officials who do not live in main areas a chance to officiate at National level events. One important thing to note is to officiate at the highest levels, you have to have a certain amount of experience officiating at lower level tournaments. Essentially you have to get your hours up to be considered for the highest levels. With electronic line calling coming in, should I still become a Line Umpire? A Line Umpire qualification is an important one to have, as most tournaments do not have the technology of Electronic Line Calling (ELC). ELC is only at ATP/WTA and high profile International Tennis Federation (ITF) events currently, so any International event such as ITF Junior Tournaments and World Tennis Tour events, Line Umpires are an important part of the event. Also once you are at the level of International Line Umpire, you can apply to be an Umpires Assistant, assisting the more senior officials with general off court officiating. What is the complaints process if I've had a bad experience with an official? If a player has had a bad experience with an official, first and foremost, they need to speak to the Tournament Director. If they don't feel comfortable discussing this they can email. The first port of call is to the region/entity that is running the event. I want to work at the ASB Classic. How do I do that? Officials at the ASB Classic have worked their way through to this level of event. Officials have to complete a course relevant to their role and have had experience in local, national and international events. <<< Click here to go back to the Officials main page Our Partners Stay up to date Join our mailing list Privacy Policy ©TENNIS NZ 2025 Join our mailing list Thank you Thanks for joining our mailing list! Check your inbox for a confirmation email and enjoy keeping up to date on Tennis New Zealand.

Team Members | Staff, Board Members & Advocates | Activity Alliance Cookies help our website to remember you and your preferences. For more information or to update your cookie settings, please go to our privacy policy . Accept Decline Skip to content. The national charity and leading voice for disabled people in sport and activity Menu . Open and close this menu with the ENTER key. How We Help Show sub-sections for 'How We Help' Programmes Facts and statistics Resources Training Research Get Active Show sub-sections for 'Get Active' How to start At home Get Involved Show sub-sections for 'Get Involved' Fundraise Campaigns Jobs in sport News About Us Show sub-sections for 'About Us' Our work Our impact Governance information Safeguarding Team Media Contact Us Donate Search Home About Us Team Our two office hubs are in Loughborough and Manchester. Many of us work remotely across England. Our Board is made up of highly experienced volunteers with a variety of skills to support our charity's strategy, policies and vision. Please see below the details for staff, Board and Advocates. You can also use the contact us form for general information. Find a team member Choose a team Staff Advocates Board Found 34 team members. Adam Blaze Chief Executive Adam joined Activity Alliance as Chief Executive in January 2023. He has over 20 years' experience in the sport industry, much of which has been spent on creating open, accessible, and inclusive opportunities for disabled people in sport and activity. His passion lies in creating meaningful and sustained change so that everyone can access opportunities to be active. Adam has a strong focus on developing people and is a qualified coach and mentor. Away from work, you will find him either playing and coaching football, or supporting one of his six children with their sporting activities. Email adamblaze@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 0808 175 6991 Ray Ashley Director of Partnerships Ray leads our partnerships and programmes work across the country. Growing our impact at local and national level, Ray is passionate about breaking down the barriers that exist for disabled people in sport and leisure. He likes nothing more than spending time with his family and travelling to faraway destinations to experience exciting new cultures and food! An Aston Villa fan, Ray also enjoys playing regular football games with his friends. Email Ray@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 0808 175 6991 Agata Sromecka Strategic Lead - Organisational Health Agata works closely with the Executive, Board, members and staff. She oversees human resources, health and safety, governance and risk management. She is passionate about seeing Activity Alliance flourish as a diverse and inclusive organisation. Building an employee-friendly organisation is important to her. Agata is a keen outdoor runner and loves amateur weightlifting as part of her fitness routine. She also loves walking her two dogs, baking and learning new languages. Email Agata@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 0808 175 6991 Alex Giles Programmes Administrator Alex started as our West Midlands Graduate Engagement Advisor in 2021. He supports our strategic partners across the region to successfully enable more disabled people to be active through sport and activity. Having a lifelong disability, he is passionate about removing barriers and tackling inequalities. He enjoys working in such a diverse region. Away from work Alex can be found watching his beloved West Bromwich Albion, coaching football, spending time with family and friends, and attending live sports events. His two defining moments are when he received his Duke of Edinburgh Gold Award from HRH The Prince Phillip and achieving his Masters in Sports Coaching. Email alex@activityalliance.org.uk Alice Evans Strategic Partnerships Advisor (West Midlands) Alice joined the partnerships team in 2024 as Strategic Partnership Advisor for the West Midlands. She joins our organisation with a background of working in an Active Partnership, and within Higher Education Sport, supporting more disabled young people to be active and find meaningful engagement within sport and physical activity. Alice enjoys being active and can often be found out on a run, in the gym, or at any given opportunity, at the coast swimming in the sea. Email Alice@ActivityAlliance.org.uk Phone 07764 291660 Andrew Whitaker Strategic Lead - Partnership Andrew joined Activity Alliance in 2021. He is Strategic Lead for the partnership team and heads up our regional work across the North West and North East of England. He loves connecting with a wide range people and partners, supporting them to embed inclusive practice into their work. Andrew’s passion stems from his own lived experiences. Growing up, he struggled to find accessible sports and activities. Now, he loves being active and has previously taken part in athletics, wheelchair sports, archery at a regional level and captained Lancashire Disabled Cricket Team. When he isn’t at home spending time with his family, you will probably find him down at the gym or at a powerlifting competition. Email Andrew@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 07764 291661 Anna Whitemore Programmes Advisor - Include to Improve Anna joined the Programmes team in October 2024 to work on the new Include to Improve programme. She brings many years of experience in the delivery of participation programmes and volunteer management gained from working at a National Governing Body of sport. Anna loves the personal stories from those achieving things they didn't think were possible and to see the positive impact that opportunities created through sport and physical activity can have on people’s lives. Outside of work, Anna can be found practicing what she preaches by volunteering, playing hockey for a local team and watching as much live sport as possible. Email Anna@activityalliance.org.uk Ashley Harris Strategic Partnerships Advisor (South West) Ashley joined the partnerships team in July 2025. He previously worked at Devon FA for 12 years leading on disability football development, creating new opportunities and links between the disability sector and football. It was there he developed his passion to improve accessibility and inclusivity in sport. Ashley will be leading on partnership work across the South West, supporting organisations to embed inclusive practice into their work. This includes supporting key partners such as Active Partnerships, Sport Governing Bodies, Local Authorities and leisure providers. In his spare time, Ashley enjoys coastal walks, football refereeing and spending time with his son and partner. Email ashley@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 07506 742222 Atul Thaker Finance Manager Atul brings 21 years' charity sector experience to Activity Alliance. As our Finance Manager, Atul provides support across the organisation. He enjoys the challenge the charity sector offers and is determined to make a difference through strong financial controls, supporting colleagues with financial processes and seeking value for money options. In his spare time, Atul can be found either cooking up a storm in the kitchen, or watching cricket, Formula One and his beloved Coventry City Football Club. Email Atul@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 0808 175 6991 Cameron Uppal Senior Policy Officer Cameron joined Activity Alliance in July 2024, brining knowledge of Policy and Public Affairs gained during his experiences at the Greater Birmingham Chambers Commerce, the Birmingham 2022 Organising Committee and the West Midlands Combined Authority. Cameron’s big passion is encouraging the nation to get moving and getting people active. From climbing Mount Kilimanjaro to taking his Grandma with him to the gym on a Saturday morning, Cameron enjoys all forms of physical activity and encourages everyone else, irrespective of their background or ability, to get involved! Email cameron@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 077642 917670 Cara Ffoulkes Strategic Partnership Advisor (London) Cara started working at Activity Alliance in April 2025. In her role, she supports key partners, including Active Partnerships, National Governing Bodies of Sport, local authorities, and leisure providers to become more effective in their role of enabling more disabled people to be active. Prior to joining the team, Cara worked in the NHS as a project officer in mental health. She has a BSc in Sport and Exercise Science and a Master’s in Health Psychology. She has a passion for improving inclusivity across organisations and improving outcomes for disabled people. When not at work, you can find Cara in the gym or out running. Email Cara@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 07436 245815 Catherine Slater Head of Partnerships Catherine leads our partnerships team and supports them to establish relationships and build effective cross-sector partnership working at local, regional and national level. Catherine is on hand to bring people together and advise on better practice. She is passionate that all people have better experiences in sport and activity and enjoys supporting organisations to improve their inclusion of disabled people. She believes strongly that disabled people deserve more choices in sport and leisure and wants to see greater representation in the workforce. Catherine loves nothing more than being outdoors, walking her boxer dog or running. In her downtime, you can find Catherine relaxing with a classic 80s film or dancing in her kitchen to classic 80s tunes! Email Catherine@activityalliance.org.uk Phone 07764 291666 Previous Page 1 2 3 Next Page Join our Newsletter Member Login Sitemap Accessibility Privacy © 2025 Activity Alliance is the operating name for the English Federation of Disability Sport.
